ingredients: 2 chicken breasts, cut into small pieces
cookingMethod:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the cornstarch, soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and 1/4 cup water. Set aside.
2. In a wok or large skillet, heat the vegetable oil and sesame oil over high heat. Add the chicken and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from the pan and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add the peanuts, celery, bell pepper, onion, and garlic. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.
4. Add the chicken back to the pan along with the soy sauce mixture. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes or until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.
5. Serve hot over rice.

1. In a large pot, bring the chicken broth to a boil over high heat. Add the chicken, bamboo shoots, mushrooms, and tofu.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the cornstarch, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and chili garlic sauce. Add this mixture to the pot and stir well.
3. Reduce the heat to medium and let the soup simmer for 10-15 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender.
4. In a small bowl, whisk the egg. Slowly pour the beaten egg into the soup, stirring gently to create egg ribbons.
5. Stir in the vegetable oil and chopped green onions. Serve hot.
